text: Despite the obvious advantages of multiplex PCR assays , they are still relatively underused compared with uniplex PCRs , possibly because of a persistent belief that multiplex assays require heavy investment into their setup and optimisation ( Elnifro et al . 2000 ) . The methods used here , however , allowed development of assays that are reliable , analytically sensitive and specific and thus fulfil the required criteria for a diagnostic qPCR assay ( Bustin et al . 2009 ) .
